title.label: Can’t continue on the game, bug stop me.

content.label: I finished the game back then, I have a blast of a time, I felt the need to come back again to finish this awesome game, sadly there’s a bug that others have mentioned. Mostly, the bug freezes the “going back in time” animation making this app not updated for the newest phone, I feel that the developers won't come back to update this and fix the problem, so that means that my only option is to buy the 3ds version of the game. So please do me a favor and don't let this version of this game swept under the rug, I want to play this version badly, so please Capcom update this game.

I bought all the chapters ages ago (I completed the game once) and I want to play it again but it won’t let me restore  any of my old purchases and while it was just 9.99 I don’t think I should have to pay twice for a game I already paid for is there anybody who can help me???

title.label: Great game, but unplayable due to bug

content.label:
Like others have said, game breaks during Rewind Time animation.
Cannot progress.
Absolute Masterpiece of a game!
I would like the gameplay to fill more of the screen on the iPhone 12 and an option to remove the green ghost background.

While it’s a nice port, I’m a little frustrated at how little game we actually get. Sure, you get a couple sections for free, but after that, you have to pay for the rest of the game! Sure, I guess it’s to be expected, but it would be just a little bit better if we got, like, two more chapters.

The game gets stuck on the first “rewind time” option, where after you click the button it freezes and loops the animation. I downloaded this when I was a kid and never got past the free chapters, and I wanted to play this again, but now I probably can’t (unless I buy the DS version??)

title.label: Game is broken on iOS 14, Wait for update

content.label: Ghost Trick is a great game, the puzzles are fun and unique, the plot is interesting and the characters and writing have charm. The only problem is, iOS 14 has broken this game and it is actually unfinishable, I got to chapter 14/18 and it just froze and I could not progress. I bought this game before iOS 14 happened but took my sweet time and I guess that was a mistake because now I cannot experience it to its fullest. Try the first two chapters for free if you want, but do not buy the whole thing for $10 until an update happens, if it ever does
You will not be able to finish this game due to a game breaking bug.
Unless your phone is so old that apple no longer supports it with OS updates, this game is basically non-functional.
I thoroughly enjoyed this game and would like to keep playing it but it’ll be kinda hard it’s too far behind on software.
The first Chapter 7 rewind cutscene just plays continuously and the game is unable to progress. I adore this game and the port is fine otherwise. Please fix this!!! :(

It doesn't work on iOS 13. Once you reach the first time rewind (about 5 minutes into the game iirc), it gets stuck on a loop and never stops. Until they update it, it doesn't matter how good the rest of the game is if you can't even play it.

I played this game in the past and it was one of my favorites...but it has not been updated to work with modern iOS devices. It seemed to work at first, but during the tutorial, a time travel animation played, and the game got stuck in a loop, playing this animation over and over again. Until this is fixed the glitch renders the game unplayable.

The game is fantastic. I’m a pretty avid gamer but rarely commit to iOS ports; however I do not own a DS anymore due to poor eyesight. The game is a satisfying, powerfully captivating narrative full of interesting plot twists, great character development, a stunning OST to accompany you every second of the way, and the unexplainable phenomenon where you just want to keep playing to find out what happens and say “5 more minutes” over and over again until it’s 6 AM and the sun has risen. The port sees some lag/memory issues in the later chapters but not significant enough to detract from the overall experience. A fantastic, memorable game that sticks with you days and weeks after finishing it.

title.label: Love it! Update: oh no, a bug???

content.label:
Update: I’m heartbroken to hear that there’s a bug making this game unplayable. I’ve played it a few times before and will always re-download it when I’m feeling nostalgic for it, but am frustrated to find that the first rewind of the game is stuck in an infinite loop. It seems like this has been going on for a while now and there haven’t been any updates to fix this. Please Capcom, make this game playable again!!

Old Review: This game was absolutely wonderful.  I have played through it twice and I am still waiting to forget the plot so I can play it a second time.  I still have yet to find a game this amazing... Quite honestly, all the other games I own seem a little dull compared to this one, but its flaw is its replay value.

The only concern/question I have about this game is why the voices from the ds game were not preserved in the mobile version.  I do not own, nor have I played the ds version, but from what I hear, there are voice actors for the characters and they each speak when they have dialogue.  I was a little disappointed when I heard that Missile had an interesting voice and I was not able to hear it in the mobile version.  I also heard that the music for the rewinding time sequence and the phone line sequence were different.  Although now that I think about it, adding more voice and music tracks would make the app take up more space than it already does, though I wouldn't mind too much.  Otherwise, incredibly great app and I will keep an eye out for a sequel!

title.label: A plot twist no one sees coming. Criminally underrated.

content.label:
This is my favorite Puzzle-story game, and one of the best games I ever played ever. That says a lot seeing as how I’ve played Half-Life 2, Portal 2, God of War, Red Dead Redemption 2, Bloodborne, and Metal Gear Solid, and much more. 
Though this is on the more expensive side for a ported game on the AppStore, the experience justified the price. 
Just flat out amazing gameplay, amazing characters, amazing music, amazing story. Just 10/10, simple as that

I absolutely love this game! I can’t put it down hardly, but my only issue is that there is some kind of glitch when I get to the scene at the Chicken Kitchen. I get to the 4 minutes before death sequence and it just keeps showing the last scene over and over. Really hope this gets fixed soon so I can keep playing :(
When I restart time at the first level it’s just the clock animation forever. Please fix this.
i got to the rewind and it just keeps looping forever :( it seems cool but it’s broken

I redownloaded this on a whim because i wanted to experience the story again but tragically it seems like this game is no longer supported, i cant even get past the first chapter because the minute i am prompted to "rewind time" the game just stops! Im very disappointed.
Don’t research it, just download it and buy all the chapters and play it. I easily had 30 hours in this game. It’s well worth it. And the price on the DS version has skyrocketed.
I liked everything about the game 10/10

title.label: NEEDS A BUG FIX, DO NOT BUY

content.label: There is a bug in the tutorial where the rewind cut scene loops forever and does not let you advance. Do not purchase until this is resolved.
I’ve played it before and it’s a great game, it just gets stuck on the rewind screen every single time I’m in the tutorial. So it’s basically a broken demo at this point.
Stuck on time rewind scene. Game looks promising
Game doesn’t work right now. Can’t get past time rewind cutscene. Fix please capcom

I was really excited to play this game. I was ready to shell out some money for the extra chapters but there is a glitch stopping you from continuing your game. When you press the “Rewind Time” button the cutscene that plays after will loop and there is no known way to fix it. I can’t give this game 5 stars if I can’t finish the tutorial due to a glitch.
The game crash is the first time you try to rewind time....

I wanted to play this game for a while so when I found it is on the iPhone, I was excited. However my game keeps crashing during the rewind cutscene and I want to know why. I am playing on the iphoneX and I have all the chapters.

title.label: Is there a game here somewhere?

content.label:
BRUTAL amounts of exposition. This game feels like clicking through an iTunes agreement if it never ended and you HAD to read the text. 

I’m going to keep giving it a try because I love adventure games and I paid money for it. If it didn’t save my progress however, I’m not sure I could go through the tutorial again.
I absolutely adore this game, and I personally think it deserves a part two!
It’s such a good game, it’s a shame they haven’t updated it in two years. I genuinely love this, but as it is now the game becomes unplayable the first time you go back in time.

As soon as I hit the rewind button in the tutorial, I’m stuck on the loading screen. Leaving the game and going back to it only resumes right before this moment where I have to keep sitting through all the dialogue. And if I refuse to resume, it deletes the save and I have to sit through even more dialogue than before. Is this the trick?

title.label: Glitch in tutorial makes game unplayable

content.label: Glitch in tutorial has you stuck at rewinding time forever - funny, but impossible to move past.
yes
The game wouldn’t continue cuz one of the 4 minutes before death cutscene wouldn’t stop looping. Fix this otherwise I’d ask for a refund

This is ridiculous. I bought the whole game and I’ve had to repeat the first chapter about 8 times now. I really enjoy where this game is going, otherwise I wouldn’t have had the patience. Every single time, when it’s time to rewind the clock for the first time, the game stops. Well, it doesn’t stop, it just keeps rewinding the clock back, never going to the next scene. I want my money back.
5stars

Loved the game on DS, but it seems it isn’t compatible with IOS. It just infinitely loops the rewind clock cutscene. Hope they fix this soon, but till then I’m requesting a refund since I purchased all the chapters already.

title.label: Still does not work on iOS 13.

content.label: 6 months later this still doesn’t work. The game gets stuck on an infinite loop during the first rewind.

If you have a device on iOS 13 DO NOT PURCHASE. THE GAME IS UNPLAYABLE, YOU CANNOT PROGRESS PAST THE FIRST AREA. It has a glitch that makes it so the loading animations loops indefinitely and the game never actually loads. Support cannot offer a fix so it’s unlikely one is on the way. It’s a great game but find another way to play it for now

This is a great game, but it’s currently broken. Don’t spend any money until the publisher fixes it! Right now various cutscenes will get stuck in an infinite loop making it impossible to play past a certain point, depending on when the game starts to malfunction.

iphone 8. game gets stuck playing the clock rewinding loop on the first “rewind time” segment. i noticed that there hasn’t been any support recently, but i hope this gets fixed, as i love ghost trick.
Game froze up in the tutorial, paid for the whole thing but can’t play past the first rewind, broken game, wouldn’t recommend on iOS
Loved the game but it is now broken so can’t play it again.
I hate how ign treated this gem they said it’s too wordy and gave it a meh score making it an underrated classic another case of bad reviewers

The game won’t work on iOS 12 or above. 
According to Capcom customer support.

There’s no way to get passed the tutorial when you rewind time for the first time. The clock animation keeps playing over and over again without continuing on after that. I was recommended this game by a friend who played this a year or two ago and it seems like the older versions worked better for her. Please fix the problem soon, I’d love to see the rest of the game.

title.label: This review is a placeholder. I require a response from the admin

content.label: Hello, I love this game, but at the first time travel section, my screen got stuck on constant "time travel". It keeps rerunning the animation, so I can't actually play the game after that point. Please help! There's only about fifteen minutes, more or less, of gameplay here, and most of it is talking.
